content:
The given chunk of code is part of a function that dynamically replaces methods in a class with new implementations. It iterates over each method in the old version of a class, compares it with the corresponding method in the new version, and prepares a list of functions to be replaced or added based on their existence in both versions. This process facilitates dynamic code updates without restarting the application.

#newFunc = types.FunctionType(newCode,
                #                             newFunc.func_globals,
                #                             newFunc.func_name,
                #                             newFunc.func_defaults,
                #                             newFunc.func_closure)
                replaceFuncList.append((oldFunc, funcName, newFunc))
            else:
                # TODO: give these new functions a proper code filename
                newFuncList.append((funcName, newFunc))
